Grzegorz Kowal

Bolsista de Produtividade em Pesquisa do CNPq - Nível 2

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/8704971530642044
  • Última atualização do currículo em 22/04/2019

Professor Doutor - MS-3, em regime de dedicação exclusiva, na EACH - Universidade de São Paulo. Concluiu seu doutorado em 2006 em Astronomia pela Universidade Jaguelônica em Cracovia, Polônia. Pós-doutorados na Universidade de Wisconsin-Madison nos Estados Unidos (2006-2009), Instituto de Astronomia, Geofísica e Ciências Atmosféricas da Universidade de São Paulo (2009-2012), Escola de Artes, Ciências e Humanidades da Universidade de São Paulo (2013-2017), e Universidade Cruzeiro do Sul (2015-2016). Assistente de pesquisa no Observatório Astronômico de Universidade Jaguelônica em Cracóvia, Polônia (2007-2010) e Pesquisador Visitante no Departamento de Física e Astronomia da Universidade McMaster em Hamilton, Canadá (2008). Atua na área de Astronomia, com ênfase em Modelagem Numérica de processos físicos clássicos e relativísticos, processos relacionados a turbulência e reconexão magnética com aplicações em Astrofísica de Plasma, Astrofísica de Altas Energias, Clima Espacial, Evolução do Meio Interestelar, Jatos Relativísticos e Meio Intracluster. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Linhas de pesquisa
1.
Reconexão magnética e processos relacionados em plasmas astrofísicos colisionais e acolisionais
Objetivo: Hoje, na comunidade astrofísica, o problema de reconexão magnética é abordado a partir de dois pontos de vista diferentes, a partir das escalas micro-físicas usando modelos numérico cinéticos acolisionais, e de estudos macroscópicos com aproximação magnetohidrodinâmica, descrevendo assim os meios colisionais. Ambas as aproximações têm os seus limites, às vezes até cobrindo espaços de parâmetros separados. Ainda não houve um estudo sistemático da comunidade para compreender a ponte entre ambos os regimes. O objetivo deste projeto é preencher esta lacuna e realizar es- tudos que permitam compreender o processo de reconexão magnética em ambos os regimes, colisionais e aproximações fluidos colisionais que permitem a presença de instabilidades cinéticas. Os estudos colisionais podem ser diretamente comparados com as simulações PIC, usando por exemplo modelos híbridos cinético-MHD. Como conseqüência desses estudos, a segunda parte deste projecto vai abranger aplicações diretas em ambos os regimes da reconexão magnética e processos relacionados, como a geração de turbulência e feedback sobre a taxa de reconexção, processo de amplificação do campo magnético, e aceleração de partículas de alta energia, a a física de raios solares, a importância de reconexão em clima espacial (por exemplo, as interações com magnetosfera e processos na cauda magnética), as interações do campo magnético solar com o campo interestelar na heliopausa, indo mais longe até as escalas de núcleos ativos de galáxias e gama-ray bursts, onde o processo de reconexção, juntamente com a turbulência, se espera que seja muito importante para a aceleração de partículas de TEV. Finalmente, as propriedades de reconexção da turbulência e em ambientes acolisionais, como o meio intergalactico, podem beneficiar significativamente com os nossos estudos..
2.
Simulações Númericas de Reconexão Magnetica
3.
Evolução dos Campos Magnéticos em Galáxias Espirais


Projetos de pesquisa
2015 - Atual
Turbulence and Magnetic reconnection in relativistic astrophysical plasmas: importance for cosmic ray acceleration and propagation in AGNs, GRBs, and Galactic Winds
Descrição: Nowadays in the astrophysical community, the problem of magnetic reconnection is usually studied in the non-relativistic case and approached using two different points of view, on microscopic scales using collisionless kinetic numerical modeling, and on macroscopic scales using magnetohydrodynamical (MHD) fluid approximation, which describes well collisional media. Both approximations have their strong points, but also significant limits, sometimes resulting in separate parameter spaces or different applications. The aim of this project is to extend the magnetic reconnection studies into the relativistic case in both regimes, collisional and collisionless. This requires an extension of our numerical tools, which work well in the classical regime, to include relativistic effects. In the case of MHD we usually apply special relativity, however, for collisionless fluid approximation based on the Chew-Goldberg-Low MHD approximation (CGL-MHD) allowing for the presence of the kinetic instabilities, relativistic version has to be derived. The results obtained with the collisionless approximation can be directly compared with the relativistic Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations, using for example a hybrid kinetic-MHD models, which dominate the studies in this regime up to date. As a consequence, this project will allow for getting a deeper insight into the reconnection problem and particle acceleration in most of the physical regimes found in the astrophysical objects, broadening application of magnetic reconnection and related processes in the relativistic regime. These applications in plasma physics cover turbulence generation and its feedback on the reconnection process, magnetic field amplification mechanism, high energetic particle acceleration and propagation, applications in highly relativistic environments, such as active galaxy nuclei and gamma ray burst, where the process of reconnection together with turbulence is expected to be very important in the acceleration of TeV particles. Moreover, the properties of turbulence and reconnection in relativistic environments can also significantly benefit from our studies..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Grzegorz Kowal - Integrante / Anderson Caproni - Integrante / Gustavo A. Lanfranchi - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior - Bolsa.
2014 - Atual
Investigation of High Energy and Plasma Astrophysics Phenomena: Theory, Numerical Simulations, Observations, and Instrument Development for the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA)
Projeto certificado pelo(a) coordenador(a) Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino em 06/01/2015.
Descrição: The High Energy and Plasma Astrophysics group of E. M. de Gouveia Dal Pino of the Instituto de Astronomia, Geologia e Ciências Atmosféricas da Universidade de São Paulo (IAG-USP), A. B. M. Valio of the Centro de Radioastronomia e Astrofísica da Universidade Mackenzie (CRAAM), and Diego Falceta Goncalves of EACH-USP, have been developing for more than a decade several correlated projects using theoretical and numerical magneto-hydrodynamics (MHD) fluid description, as well as observational tools, to investigate astrophysical plasmas and high energy phenomena. In the recent years, our group has been also involved in the Cherenkov Telescope Array (CTA) Project, an international collaboration (involving 26 countries) aiming the construction of a new generation of ground-based gamma-ray telescopes, between 2016-2020. CTA will provide the deepest ever insight into the non-thermal, high-energy universe and allow significant contributions to cosmology, astroparticle physics and, in particular, to cosmic ray accelerators, cosmic magnetic fields and gamma-ray burst (GRB) investigation. In this proposal we got funding from FAPESP to support the construction of 3 Cherenkov telescopes to complete the ASTRI-CTA Mini-Array, in partnership with INAF- Italy and South-Africa. This Mini-Array of 7 telescopes will be the precursor and the core of the full CTA. The participation in the Mini-Array construction will ensure to the Brazilian members a solid involvement with the CTA Besides, in view of the extensive number of related projects being developed by our group, we also obtained funding to upgrade our computational facilities with a clustar of over 700 cores..
Situação: Em andamento; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Grzegorz Kowal - Integrante / Diego Antonio Falceta Gonçalves - Integrante / Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Adriana Benetti Marques Válio - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2013 - 2017
Magnetic Reconnection and Related Processes in Collisional and Collisionless Astrophysical Plasmas: from solar flares to extragalactic sources
Descrição: Nowadays in the astrophysical community, the problem of magnetic reconnection is approached using two different points of view, from the micro-physical scale using collisionless kinetic numerical studies, and from macroscopic magnetohydrodynamical fluid approximation studies, describing well the collisional media. Both approximations have their strong points, but also significant limits, sometimes resulting in separate parameter spaces. There is no real afford taken to understand the bridge between those two approximations applied to the magnetic reconnection problem. The aim of this project is to fill this gap and perform studies which allow to understand the precess of reconnection in both regimes, collisional and collisionless. The collisionless studies, using the Chew-Goldberg-Low magnetohydrodynamics fluid approximation (CGL-MHD) allowing for the presence of the kinetic instabilities, can be directly compared with the Particle-in-Cell (PIC) simulations, using for example a hybrid kinetic-MHD models, which dominate the studies in this regime up to date. As a consequence, the second part of this project will cover the applications of the magnetic reconnection and related processes in both regimes. These applications in plasma physics cover turbulence generation and feedback on the reconnection process, magnetic field amplification mechanism, high energetic particle acceleration. The results have applications in the physics of solar flares, the importance of reconnection in space weather (e.g. interactions with magnetosphere and processes in magnetotail), the interactions of solar magnetic field with the interstellar field in the heliopause, going further up to the scales of active galaxy nuclei and gamma ray burst, where the process of reconnection together with turbulence is expected to be very important in the acceleration of TeV particles. Finally, the properties of turbulence and reconnection in collisionless environments, such intracluster medium, can benefit significantly from our studies..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Grzegorz Kowal - Coordenador / Diego Antonio Falceta Gonçalves - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
Número de produções C, T & A: 14
2011 - 2014
Magnetic Field Effects And Particle Acceleration in Gamma-Ray Bursts (GRBS): Theory, Numerical Simulations, and Observational Prospects
Descrição: Joint Proposal FAPESP-HEBREW University of Jerusalem (HUJ) (process: 2011/51275-4): Supersonic jets are ubiquitous in the Universe as they are associated to a wide variety of astrophysical objects - from young stars to gamma-ray-bursts (GRBs). In particular, GRBs are the most energetic and probably most mysterious phenomena in the cosmos and in this joint Proposal with Prof. T. Piran of HUJ, one of the most prominent experts in the world in GRBs theory, we aim to investigate several aspects of the physics of the ultrarelativistic jets associated to GRBs. In this context, we plan to study: magnetic field reconnection, magnetic turbulence, MHD dynamics of jets, and particle acceleration by collisionless magnetized shocks and by magnetic reconnection within the relativistic regime. This project will maximize the synergy between the two groups. The research will involve both analytic techniques and numerical simulations. It will also involve analysis of astronomical satellite data concerning GRBs and the possibility to make theoretical predictions for the coming CTA (Cherenkov Telescope Array) gamma-ray observatory..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Grzegorz Kowal - Integrante / Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Tsvi Piran - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
Número de produções C, T & A: 2

Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Grzegorz Kowal - Integrante / Diego Antonio Falceta Gonçalves - Integrante / Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador / Alex Cavaliéri Carciofi - Integrante / Paula Rodrigues Teixeira Coelho - Integrante / Beatriz Leonor Silveira Barbuy - Integrante.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Auxílio financeiro.
2009 - 2012
Fast Magnetic Reconnection and Particle Acceleration in Astrophysical Sources and Diffuse Media
Projeto certificado pelo(a) coordenador(a) Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino em 06/01/2015.
Descrição: One of the fundamental properties of astrophysical magnetic fields is an ability to change their topology through a process known as magnetic reconnection. There is no possible understanding of the origin and evolution of the large-scale magnetic field without understanding the way magnetic field lines change. In a typical astrophysical plasma, magnetic diffusion of the medium is negligible and the so called ?frozen-in? condition is responsible for the change of magnetic topology. Reconnection is essential for understanding a wide variety of astrophysical processes, including stellar and galactic dynamos, astrophysical turbulence and the structure of accretion disks. To account for solar or star flares, the solar cycle, and the structure of the galactic magnetic field, reconnection must be fast, propagating with a speed close to the Alfv ́en speed. Earlier attempts to deal with magnetic reconnection assumed that the magnetized fluids are laminar and as a result they led to slow reconnection rates. The presence of a random magnetic field component substantially enhances the reconnection rate and enables fast reconnection, i.e., reconnection that does not depend on fluid resistivity. The enhancement of the reconnection rate is achieved via a combination of two effects. First of all, only small segments of magnetic field lines are subject to direct Ohmic annihilation. Thus the fraction of magnetic energy that goes directly into fluid heating goes to zero as fluid resistivity vanishes. However, the most important enhancement comes from the fact that unlike the laminar fluid case where reconnection is constrained to proceed line by line, the presence of turbulence enables many magnetic field lines to enter the reconnection zone simultaneously. A significant fraction of magnetic energy goes into MHD turbulence and this enhances reconnection rates through an increase in the field stochasticity. In this way magnetic reconnection becomes fast when field stochasticityaccounted for. As a consequence solar and galactic dynamos are also fast, i.e., do not dependfluid resistivity. Another important issue in reconnection theory is on how the released energy in this process is transformed in heating and particle acceleration. on.
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.

Integrantes: Grzegorz Kowal - Integrante / Elisabete Maria de Gouveia Dal Pino - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): Fundação de Amparo à Pesquisa do Estado de São Paulo - Bolsa.
Número de produções C, T & A: 4
